item.title: 물고기 vs. 생선
item.author: Author
item.description: 물고기 = fish (living fish) 생선 = fish (to eat) 해산물 = seafood Both 물고기 and 생선 have the literally meaning of fish but they’re used in different contexts. 물고기 refers to a living fish and is used to refer to a broad range of swimming animials with spines and gills. Things like sharks, tuna, goldfish, etc. But a jellyfish or a starfish. 생선 refers to fish you eat. More specially, fish that have purposely been cuaght for eating, like the salmon on your dinner plate.
